description: ARCHITECTURE: Application uses LangChain DeepAgents framework (langchain-ai/deepagents) as the core agent harness with planning, filesystem backend, and sub-agent delegation
steps: Step 1: Verify deepagents package is installed (uv add deepagents)
Step 2: Verify create_deep_agent is imported from deepagents module
Step 3: Verify agent is created using create_deep_agent() with custom tools
Step 4: Verify TodoListMiddleware provides write_todos and read_todos tools
Step 5: Verify FilesystemMiddleware provides ls, read_file, write_file, edit_file, glob, grep tools
Step 6: Verify SubAgentMiddleware provides task() tool for sub-agent delegation
Step 7: Verify SummarizationMiddleware handles context exceeding 170k tokens
Step 8: Verify AnthropicPromptCachingMiddleware is enabled for cost reduction
Step 9: Verify HumanInTheLoopMiddleware handles tool approval with interrupt_on config
Step 10: Verify backend is configured (StateBackend, FilesystemBackend, or CompositeBackend)
Step 11: Verify agent.invoke() returns proper ResultMessage with LangGraph state
Step 12: Verify streaming responses work via agent event stream
Step 13: Verify custom subagents can be registered using subagents parameter
Step 14: Verify long-term memory works via CompositeBackend with StoreBackend routes

description: Application loads without errors and displays the main chat interface
steps: Step 1: Open the application URL in a browser
Step 2: Verify the page loads completely without console errors
Step 3: Confirm the three-column layout is visible (sidebar, chat, panel)
Step 4: Verify the header with model selector is present
Step 5: Confirm the input area with send button is visible at the bottom

description: User can send a chat message and receive a streaming response from the AI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the chat interface
Step 2: Type 'Hello, how are you?' in the input field
Step 3: Click the send button or press Enter
Step 4: Verify the user message appears in the chat
Step 5: Verify a streaming response begins from the AI
Step 6: Confirm the response completes and is fully displayed
Step 7: Verify the typing indicator disappears after response completes

description: User can create a new conversation using the new chat button
steps: Step 1: Navigate to the chat interface with an existing conversation
Step 2: Click the 'New Chat' button in the sidebar
Step 3: Verify a new conversation is created
Step 4: Confirm the chat area is cleared and shows welcome screen
Step 5: Verify the new conversation appears in the sidebar list

description: User can switch between existing conversations in the sidebar
steps: Step 1: Create at least two conversations with messages
Step 2: Click on a different conversation in the sidebar
Step 3: Verify the chat area updates to show the selected conversation
Step 4: Confirm all messages from the selected conversation are displayed
Step 5: Switch back to the original conversation
Step 6: Verify the original messages are restored

description: User can rename a conversation using inline editing
steps: Step 1: Create a new conversation and send a message
Step 2: Locate the conversation title in the header or sidebar
Step 3: Click the pencil icon or double-click the title
Step 4: Enter a new name 'My Test Conversation'
Step 5: Press Enter or click outside to save
Step 6: Verify the new name is displayed in the sidebar

description: User can delete a conversation with confirmation dialog
steps: Step 2: Hover over the conversation in the sidebar
Step 3: Click the delete button (trash icon)
Step 4: Verify a confirmation dialog appears
Step 6: Verify the conversation is removed from the list
Step 7: Confirm the conversation no longer appears when refreshing

description: Markdown rendering works correctly in assistant messages
steps: Step 1: Send a message asking AI to respond with markdown formatting
Step 3: Verify headers are rendered with proper styling
Step 4: Verify bold and italic text renders correctly
Step 5: Verify bullet points and numbered lists render properly
Step 7: Verify inline code is styled correctly
Step 8: Verify blockquotes are properly indented

description: Code blocks display with syntax highlighting and copy button
steps: Step 1: Send a message asking AI to write a Python function
Step 2: Wait for the code block response
Step 3: Verify the code block has syntax highlighting
Step 4: Verify the language label shows 'python'
Step 5: Locate and click the copy button
Step 6: Verify the code is copied to clipboard
Step 7: Verify a 'Copied!' feedback message appears

description: User can stop a streaming response mid-generation
steps: Step 1: Send a message requesting a long response
Step 2: While the response is streaming, locate the stop button
Step 5: Verify the partial response remains visible
Step 6: Verify the regenerate button becomes available

description: User can regenerate the last AI response
steps: Step 1: Send a message and wait for the response
Step 2: Locate the regenerate button on the last assistant message
Step 4: Verify a new response begins streaming
Step 5: Verify the previous response is replaced
Step 6: Confirm the new response completes successfully

description: User can edit and resend their previous message
steps: Step 1: Send a message and receive a response
Step 2: Click the edit button on the user message
Step 4: Click submit or press Enter
Step 6: Verify a new AI response is generated
Step 7: Verify conversation history branches appropriately

description: Multi-line messages work with Shift+Enter for newlines
steps: Step 1: Click in the input field
Step 5: Verify the input field shows two lines
Step 7: Verify the message displays with proper line breaks

description: Input textarea auto-resizes as user types more content
steps: Step 1: Click in the input field
Step 2: Note the initial height of the textarea
Step 3: Type multiple lines using Shift+Enter
Step 4: Verify the textarea height increases
Step 6: Verify the textarea height decreases
Step 7: Verify there is a maximum height with scrollbar

description: Model selector dropdown allows switching between AI models
steps: Step 1: Locate the model selector in the header
Step 2: Click to open the dropdown
Step 3: Verify Claude Sonnet 4.5, Haiku 4.5, and Opus 4.1 are listed
Step 5: Verify the selector updates to show the new model
Step 7: Verify the response comes from the selected model

description: Sidebar can be collapsed and expanded on desktop
steps: Step 1: Verify the sidebar is visible on desktop view
Step 2: Click the sidebar toggle button
Step 3: Verify the sidebar collapses with animation
Step 4: Verify the main chat area expands to fill space
Step 5: Click the toggle button again
Step 6: Verify the sidebar expands back

description: Conversations are grouped by date in sidebar (Today, Yesterday, etc.)
steps: Step 1: Create multiple conversations over different dates (mock data)
Step 2: View the sidebar conversation list
Step 3: Verify 'Today' group contains recent conversations
Step 4: Verify 'Yesterday' group exists for older conversations

description: Search functionality filters conversations by title and content
steps: Step 1: Create multiple conversations with distinct topics
Step 2: Locate the search input in the sidebar
Step 3: Type a search term that matches one conversation
Step 4: Verify the list filters to show matching conversations
Step 7: Search for content within messages
Step 8: Verify conversations containing that content are shown

description: User can pin important conversations to keep them at the top
steps: Step 2: Right-click or click the menu icon on the conversation
Step 3: Select 'Pin' from the context menu
Step 4: Verify a pin icon appears on the conversation
Step 5: Verify the conversation moves to a 'Pinned' section at top
Step 7: Verify it returns to its original position

description: User can archive conversations to hide them from main list
steps: Step 4: Verify the conversation disappears from main list
Step 5: Navigate to archived conversations view
Step 6: Verify the archived conversation appears there
Step 8: Verify it returns to main list

description: User can duplicate an existing conversation
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation with some messages
Step 4: Verify a new conversation is created
Step 5: Verify the new conversation contains all messages from original
Step 6: Verify the title indicates it's a copy

description: Export conversation as JSON format
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation with several messages
Step 5: Verify a JSON file downloads
Step 6: Open the file and verify it contains all messages
Step 7: Verify metadata like timestamps and model are included
notes: Backend endpoint + frontend UI implemented and tested

description: Export conversation as Markdown format
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation with code blocks and formatting
Step 5: Open the file and verify messages are properly formatted
Step 6: Verify code blocks are preserved
notes: Backend endpoint + frontend UI implemented and tested

description: Image upload via file picker works correctly
steps: Step 1: Locate the attachment button in the input area
Step 3: Select an image file from the file picker
Step 4: Verify the image thumbnail appears in the input area
Step 5: Type a message 'What is in this image?'
Step 7: Verify the image is displayed in the conversation
Step 8: Verify AI responds about the image content

description: Image paste from clipboard works correctly
steps: Step 1: Copy an image to clipboard (screenshot or copy from browser)
Step 2: Click in the input textarea
Step 4: Verify the image appears as an attachment
Step 5: Send a message with the image
Step 6: Verify the image displays in the conversation

description: Drag and drop file attachment works correctly
steps: Step 1: Open a file explorer window with an image
Step 2: Drag the image file over the input area
Step 3: Verify a drop zone visual indicator appears
Step 5: Verify the file appears as an attachment
Step 6: Verify the attachment can be removed before sending
notes: Implemented with dragOver, dragLeave, drop handlers

description: Extended thinking mode can be enabled for complex problems
steps: Step 1: Locate the extended thinking toggle
Step 3: Verify the toggle shows as enabled
Step 4: Send a complex analytical question
Step 6: Verify the thinking process is shown (collapsible)
Step 7: Verify the final response includes deeper analysis
notes: Implemented with toggle in Header, thinking events in backend, and collapsible display in MessageBubble

description: Thinking process is collapsible in message display
steps: Step 1: Enable extended thinking and send a message
Step 2: Wait for the response with thinking
Step 3: Locate the thinking section in the message
Step 4: Verify it can be collapsed
Step 6: Verify thinking content is hidden
notes: Thinking content is collapsible in MessageBubble with expand/collapse toggle

description: Settings modal opens and displays all setting categories
steps: Step 1: Click the settings icon in the sidebar
Step 2: Verify the settings modal opens
Step 3: Verify tabs for General, Appearance, Advanced, etc. exist
Step 5: Verify content loads for each tab
Step 6: Close the modal with X button

description: Theme switching between light, dark, and auto modes
steps: Step 4: Verify the UI changes to dark colors
Step 6: Verify the UI changes to light colors
Step 8: Verify theme matches system preference

description: Font size adjustment affects the interface
steps: Step 5: Verify text throughout the app increases

description: Custom instructions can be set and affect AI responses
steps: Step 3: Enter instruction: 'Always respond in Spanish'
Step 7: Verify AI responds in Spanish
Step 8: Clear custom instructions and verify normal responses

description: Temperature control slider affects response creativity
steps: Step 4: Send 'Give me a creative story idea'
Step 8: Verify response differs in creativity

description: Max tokens setting limits response length
steps: Step 3: Send a message requesting a long explanation
Step 4: Verify response is truncated around 100 tokens
Step 7: Verify response can be longer

description: Project creation and management works correctly
steps: Step 4: Select a color and icon
Step 6: Verify project appears in project selector
Step 8: Verify conversations filter to project scope

description: Move conversation between projects
steps: Step 2: Create a conversation in Project A
Step 6: Verify conversation disappears from Project A view
Step 8: Verify conversation appears in Project B
notes: Backend endpoint /conversations/{id}/move implemented. Frontend MoveModal and handleMove function added to Sidebar. API service has moveConversation method.

description: Project-specific custom instructions override global instructions
steps: Step 1: Set global custom instruction to 'Be formal'
Step 2: Create a project with instruction 'Be casual and fun'
Step 3: Start conversation outside any project
Step 7: Verify AI is casual and fun
notes: ChatInput component retrieves project instructions from store, falls back to global. Agent route get_effective_custom_instructions handles project lookup. Backend agent endpoints use project instructions when available.

description: Upload files to project knowledge base
steps: Step 2: Navigate to project files/knowledge base
Step 6: Verify file appears in project files list
Step 7: Start a conversation referencing the file content
Step 8: Verify AI can access the document content
notes: Backend: POST/GET/DELETE /api/projects/{id}/files with file upload/download. Frontend: ProjectFilesModal.tsx with upload UI. ProjectFiles component in ProjectModal. Header.tsx includes Files button. Tests: 6 passing tests in test_project_file_upload.py

description: Artifact detection renders code artifacts in side panel
steps: Step 1: Send a message: 'Create a React component for a button'
Step 2: Wait for AI response with code artifact
Step 3: Verify the artifacts panel opens automatically
Step 4: Verify the code is displayed with syntax highlighting
Step 5: Verify the artifact title shows component name

description: HTML artifact preview renders correctly with live preview
steps: Step 1: Send a message: 'Create an HTML page with a form'
Step 3: Verify artifacts panel shows HTML preview
Step 4: Verify the form renders correctly in preview
Step 5: Interact with form elements in preview
Step 6: Verify CSS styles are applied
Step 7: Toggle between code view and preview

description: SVG artifact renders as graphic in preview
steps: Step 1: Send a message: 'Create an SVG icon of a star'
Step 3: Verify SVG renders as graphic in artifacts panel
Step 4: Verify code view shows SVG markup
Step 6: Verify downloaded file opens correctly

description: Mermaid diagram artifact renders correctly
steps: Step 1: Send a message: 'Create a Mermaid flowchart for user login'
Step 3: Verify Mermaid diagram renders visually
Step 4: Verify flowchart shows correct nodes and connections
Step 6: Verify Mermaid syntax is visible

description: Download artifact content as file
steps: Step 1: Create an artifact (code or document)

description: Edit artifact and re-prompt for changes
steps: Step 2: Click the edit button on the artifact
Step 4: Enter a prompt: 'Add error handling to this code'

description: Artifact version history navigation
steps: Step 2: Edit and re-prompt to create a new version
Step 3: Repeat to create a third version

description: Full-screen artifact view toggle
steps: Step 2: Click the full-screen toggle button
Step 3: Verify artifact expands to full viewport

Step 5: Click exit full-screen or press Escape

description: Multiple artifacts can be viewed in tabs
steps: Step 1: Create multiple artifacts in one conversation
Step 2: Verify tabs appear in artifacts panel

Step 6: Verify tab disappears and another becomes active

description: LaTeX/math equations render correctly with KaTeX
steps: Step 1: Send a message: 'Show me the quadratic formula'
Step 2: Wait for response with math notation
Step 3: Verify the equation renders properly
Step 4: Verify inline math expressions render
Step 5: Verify display-mode equations are centered
Step 6: Verify complex equations like integrals render

description: Conversation branching creates alternative paths from any message
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation with several exchanges
Step 2: Hover over a middle message
Step 4: Send a different message from that point
Step 5: Verify a new branch is created
Step 8: Verify each branch has independent history

description: Branch visualization shows conversation tree structure
steps: Step 1: Create a conversation with multiple branches
Step 3: Verify tree structure displays correctly
Step 4: Verify branch points are marked
Step 5: Click on a branch node
Step 6: Verify conversation switches to that branch

description: Checkpoint system creates restore points
steps: Step 4: Add a note 'Before major change'
Step 5: Continue conversation with more messages
Step 7: Verify checkpoint appears with timestamp and note

description: Restore conversation to previous checkpoint
steps: Step 1: Create a checkpoint at message 5
Step 7: Verify conversation reverts to message 5 state
Step 8: Verify later messages are removed

description: Compare checkpoint states with diff view
steps: Step 1: Create two checkpoints at different points
Step 3: Select both checkpoints for comparison
Step 5: Verify diff view opens showing differences
Step 6: Verify added messages are highlighted
Step 7: Verify removed content is indicated

description: Todo list displays agent's task planning progress

Step 2: Verify todo panel opens with task list
Step 3: Verify tasks are listed with pending status
Step 4: Verify tasks update to in_progress as agent works
Step 5: Verify completed tasks show checkmarks
Step 6: Verify progress bar updates accordingly

description: Diff viewer shows file changes made by agent

Step 5: Verify modified content shows on right
